{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3330374,"name":"Salvo Bonsma","username":"ampersanded","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/ad7895/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T20:11:13.042Z","cooked":"

I am using Photon Vision pose estimations and feeding its pose estimate and timestamp into yagsl‚Äôs addVisionMeasurement(). This method is currently working fine but it may be affecting my auto‚Äôs performance. I heard from a mentor that there is a better way to do pose estimation from vision (something about filtering) but he didn‚Äôt elaborate.

Code:

  • Vision Subsystem
  • Drive Subsystem

You can scale your standard deviations based on the distance to the AprilTag or only add vision measurements when in a certain range. We use the latter approach.

What do you recommend this range be?

We use limelights and their os. They give a camerapose and we use the z value, I assume it‚Äôs in meters. Our range is 2.5 meters and deviations are 0.5 meters for translation and 30 degrees for rotation.

Team 6328 has great approaches for filtering for pose estimation. I would check them out.

FRC 6328 Mechanical Advantage 2024 Build Thread Open Alliance
Software Update: Northstar, Field Tolerances, and Thoughts on Pose Estimation This is a great question, and one that has been the subject of significant discussion after last weekend‚Äôs events. We‚Äôd like to share our perspective, as a team that has played over 150 matches with full-field AprilTag localization. While we can‚Äôt draw any absolute conclusions, we hope that this might clear up some confusion and shift teams in the right direction. What happened at Granite State? After a full event‚Äôs ‚Ä¶
